sources.data_found: UND's new system comprises 34 nodes; 27 compute, 2 management, 3 Ceph, and 1 NAS, allowing for 2 petaflops of power using GPU algorithms, and with CPU performance in the region of 60 teraflops. Combined HPE technologies offer unprecedented performance with industry-leading GPUs, fast GPU interconnect, high bandwidth fabric, and a configurable GPU topology to match UND's workloads.

These are the newest nodes in the Talon cluster. All of these nodes have higher core counts than previous generations with select nodes containing additional memory or GPU accelerators for more demanding workloads.

UND's new system comprises 34 nodes; 27 compute, 2 management, 3 Ceph, and 1 NAS, allowing for 2 petaflops of power using GPU algorithms, and with CPU performance in the region of 60 teraflops. After an evaluation process, UND chose to build its supercomputer with the HPE DL360 and Apollo 6500 Gen10 systems, an ideal end-to-end platform to support deep learning while delivering high-performance, versatility and security for workload management.

student_data.notes: Specific CS enrollment data not found. DataUSA shows 3,596 total degrees awarded across all programs at UND in 2023, but does not break down enrollment by CS major. Total enrollment is 14,172 students (10,216 undergraduate, 3,956 graduate). The university offers BS, MS, and PhD programs in Computer Science through the School of Electrical Engineering & Computer Science. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: UND sources from 2019 mention 'industry-leading GPUs' in the HPE Apollo 6500 Gen10 system, achieving 2 petaflops with GPU algorithms. The exact GPU models and quantities were not specified in available documentation.

gpu_resources.notes: UND's Talon cluster comprises 34 nodes total (27 compute nodes). The system achieves '2 petaflops of power using GPU algorithms' but specific GPU models and counts are not detailed in available sources. The cluster uses HPE Apollo 6500 Gen10 systems with 'industry-leading GPUs, fast GPU interconnect, high bandwidth fabric, and a configurable GPU topology.' Without access to detailed technical specifications, GPU counts cannot be determined.

analysis_notes: Data collected shows UND operates the Talon HPC cluster with GPU capabilities, but specific GPU models and quantities could not be determined from public sources. CS student enrollment numbers are also not publicly available in detail.
